intro: Chaptalia integrifolia var. leiocarpa, commonly known as the smooth-seeded chaptalia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its basal rosette of lanceolate, hairy leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in composite heads, typical of the daisy family. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in its native range.
